title: Hess Posts Wider 3Q Loss, Less Revenue
text:
By Dave Sebastian

Hess Corp. (HES) posted a wider third-quarter loss as its revenue fell.

The company reported a loss of $205 million, or 68 cents a share, compared with a loss of $42 million, or 18 cents a share, in the same quarter last year. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting a loss of 29 cents a share.

Hess said its adjusted loss was 32 cents a share. Analysts were expecting an adjusted loss of 31 cents a share.

Revenue and non-operating income was $1.52 billion, compared with $1.83 billion a year ago. Analysts were expecting $1.52 billion.

Write to Dave Sebastian at dave.sebastian@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 30, 2019 08:00 ET (12:00 GMT)
